name: Nobis Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we were recommended the Stallmästargården by Swedish friends they acknowledged that the location may be a bit remote for a 3 day visit to Stockholm. The new Nobis Hotel, run by the same group but in the city centre overlooking Normalmstorg and a short walk from the harbour, Gamla Stan, Djurgarden and other attractions seemed an ideal alternative.
reviews.title: Cutting edge luxury in central Stockholm

reviews.text: This was confirmed when we were contacted by the concierge two weeks before our visit, asking if there were any arrangements he could make for us. Although sometimes sceptical of such offers, assuming cynically that they might have a cousin with a taxi or friend with a kebab stall, we sought his advice and he arranged bookings for us a some fantastic restaurants (eg Lux, F12) we would either not have known about or not been able to get in without his help.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: The hotel itself was equally fabulous, a little funky with very comfortable stylish rooms. Our was billed as a 1room junior suite which meant it was a little larger than average. Normally a hotel which provides 150 page book describing all the design aspects of the room furniture and furnishing might be considered a touch self indulgent but in this instance it was fascinating to read about the inspiration for the light fittings or the origin of the wardrobe doors. We had a large sunny room overlooking the square, with large bed, comfortable seating area, plenty of hanging space and large well equipped bathroom (although as other have noted lacking in shelf space). Décor was tasteful modern, greys and aubergines; our only complaint was the TV and sound system was too sophisticated to plug in our ipad/iphone. (they said they didn't have the appropriate cables and each room had a different system, although they did offer the loan of an ipad)
reviews.title: An ok hotel, the room design is nice to look at and very inconvenient to live in

reviews.text: Created from two adjoining heritage buildings, the public areas were v attractive, with interesting furniture and decor items, particularly the large central lobby with its groups of sofas, coffee tables, model ships and aeroplanes. The light fittings particularly are a source of interest. We didn't use the small but stylish Gold bar but enjoyed coffee in the adjacent cafe.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast which was included in the room rate was one of the best we have encountered in many years travelling, in a stylish basement level restaurant, and included many local products, smoked meats, all sorts of berries, marmalades and jams and excellent coffee.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location, great staff

reviews.text: Stayed here on business in September. Everything was top notch: the staff and their efficiency and helpfulness, the bistro which had some of the most delicious food I've eaten and the bars which were buzzing (but not rowdy) and ever so cool. The design style is a feature in itself and the public spaces are as beautiful as the rooms themselves.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.text: A special word for the beds which were so so so comfortable it was hard to get up for my meeting and the rooms were stocked with the best gadgets + toiletries imaginable.
reviews.title: Beautiful But NOT Practical

reviews.text: A simply wonderful experience in a great city.
reviews.title: Impressed

reviews.text: There is no denying that this hotel is designed beautifully, but unfortunately it is at the expense of any practicality.
reviews.title: I was really impressed!

reviews.text: I travel frequently on business and was on a week-long trip across Scandinavia. I had hoped this hotel would be the best on our trip given it's hefty room prices, but unfortunately it just wasnt.
reviews.title: Modern and cosy hotel situated in the hart of Stockholm

reviews.text: It is a classic design hotel. You'll have clean design, personnel selected to appeal and appear ( if you're lucky wram welcoming if not a bit distant) iMacs on reception, iPads availables, soft grey decor, soft lights, spacious room with nice decor, great bathroom, great minibar, a very good Italian restaurant (reading the menu, not tried unfortunately) yet...
reviews.title: Good with unexpected gifts

reviews.text: Be careful don't ask for a taxi at the hour you want to leave they are able to book it but not able to explain that it will be very difficult to have it on time ( of the 4 days I've been there 3 times taxis were late, quote from the receptionist " you know it's Stockholm and it's raining!", sorry but it is not acceptable)
reviews.title: A positive Surprise in Stockholm

reviews.text: Some times the late night room service can change the supply from night to night without any reason or justification
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but understand practicality concerns

reviews.text: Bar is nicely design if you like the semi dark ambient, very good the execution, yet very poor the selection!!!
reviews.title: So easy to get annoyed at Nobis

reviews.text: Hotel is located right in the middle of the action, whether that means shopping, entertainment (with a very nice lobby bar right in the hotel) museums or boat excursions to the archipelago. Rooms are nordic style furnished, not overly large, but with everything you need to make your stay comfortable on this recently inaugurated hotel. Worth a stay, even more so if you are able to catch a special rate.
reviews.title: Nice location, trendy but on the expensive side

reviews.text: Stayed in Nobis for the last week end of December 2011.
reviews.title: Perfect place to discover Stockholm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, the situation of the place is perfect to start any of the city tour by walking... Whether you want to go shopping, visiting, or just walking.
reviews.title: Very Good!!!

reviews.text: We had 2 fantastic superior rooms facing the nice square. Rooms 355 and 357 are next the big clock you can see from outside, so we were happy to be at the ideal floor and situation in the building to overlook the town.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in Stockholm

reviews.text: We travel a lot and are used to 4 to 5 star places that have a very strong reputation. Nobis is a fair place, elegant and cosy, ideal for a stay if you are a couple (straight or gay), friends, and even family.
reviews.title: Contemporary and sleek - perfect for a weekend away

reviews.text: 1) The wardrobe had almost no space for hanging clothing and only 2 coat-hangers. My boss had a similar room and had to hang his suit jackets and shirts over the shower and bathroom doors.
reviews.title: Terrible Room !!!

reviews.text: The Nobis is clearly the nicest hotel I have stayed in in Stockholm. Its location is great and in close proximity to shopping streets, the old town, plenty of good restaurants etc.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel - but ... the bar in the Atrium is misplaced

reviews.text: Great location in the city centre, close to shops and restaurants. Very stylish and trendy.
reviews.title: Very nice and stylish hotel

reviews.text: The room was comfortable and clean, but a little bit small. I guess for Swedish standards it's not that small at all. I have heard about 10 m2 rooms without windows. Well, my room was definitely a lot bigger and had a window. There was some noise on friday and saturday evening from the bars nearby, but it wasn't that disturbing en probably the downside of staying in the city's centre. Staff is very helpfull, the gym was good en breakfast was nice as well. Wireless internet is free. I had a great stay and would return to this hotel if I were visiting Stockholm again.
reviews.title: More 4 and a half

reviews.text: The only reason I wouldn't give 5 stars was just the room size, which is as most people have said is a bit on the small side. Otherwise, I was incredibly impressed with the staff, I thought the breakfast was quite good, and the beds were very nice. Oh, and location couldn't have been better. Funny reading the reviews because I thought I was the only one who noticed how attractive the staff were. Also, the business travelers/guests, as well as most people we saw in Stockholm, were very good looking and stylish.
reviews.title: Stylish business hotel

reviews.text: But more importantly, coming from the US, this was our first hotel on the trip and it was so great to have such helpful, friendly people guiding us in their country. I would highly recommend the Nobis Hotel!
reviews.title: Stylish with marvelous beds, fantastic toiletries and great breakfast

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location for shops and restaurants. Very stylish. The rooms are on the small side but well finished, nice bathrooms and a really comfortable bed.
reviews.title: A quite nice hotel located in very good place

description: Stockholm’s new contemporary hotelOccupying a prime spot at Norrmalmstorg square, the single most central and attractive location in downtown Stockholm, Nobis Hotel is an independent, 201-room first class hotel. Nobis Hotel is a new center stage of Sweden’s Royal Capital, defining our own personal sense of luxury — one that is modern, elegant and extremely comfortable, but also ethically sound, warm and moderate, providing our guests with true value for their money in a stylish and pleasant setting designed by award-winning architects Claesson Koivisto Rune.
